summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an attorney named Arthur, following up on a conversation regarding a client who received a grand jury subpoena. The prosecutors wish to speak with the client about his knowledge of and interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, particularly regarding statements the client made to the press about comments Epstein made concerning his prior conduct.

persons.name: Arthur
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena; the prosecutor is coordinating with him to schedule an interview with his client regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation; prosecutors want to question a witness about his knowledge of and interactions with Epstein, particularly regarding statements Epstein made about his prior conduct.

connections.description: Arthur's client (unnamed) has knowledge of and interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, which is the subject of the prosecutor's inquiry.

events.title: Prosecutor Follow-up on Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails defense attorney Arthur to follow up on a conversation about Arthur's client who received a grand jury subpoena, aiming to schedule an interview regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A client of attorney Arthur received a grand jury subpoena in connection with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
Prosecutors state they have no current reason to believe Arthur's client has done anything wrong, but wish to speak with him about his knowledge of Epstein.
The inquiry is specifically focused on recent statements the client made to the press about comments Epstein made to him regarding Epstein's prior conduct.
The correspondence indicates an active phase of witness interviews in the SDNY investigation in August 2019.
